p.s: In the excerpt from President Barack Obama's speech Remarks of president Barack Obama at student roundtable, Barack Obama uses in order to encourage his listeners to take part in intercultural exchanges, delivered on 7th April 2009 in Istanbul, Turkey at the Culture and Arts Center of Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University in Tophane he tells about the importance of intercultural understanding and student exchanges.

The extract is devideddivided into three sections, starting with an introduction, in which Mr. Obama wants to attract the students attention by speaking of the new spirit of activism and responsibility (l. 4) young people have.
He refers it to young Americans (ll. 5-7).
Mr. President also compliments the younger generation as passionate, engaged, [...] (ll. 7-8).

In the main part Mr. Barack Obama tries to develop his main idea connect young Americans to young people all around the world (l. 9) further by telling several arguments step by step starting off with pointing out the opportunities someone would have of an exchange (ll. 9-11).
Furthermore he explains that simple exchanges can break down walls between us (l. 13).
He backs up this statement by giving exchanges/going aboardabroad as a solution to reveal humanity (l. 14).
Moreover he mentions the regained trust which covers the smaller diffrencesdifferences and shows what we share (ll. 16-17).
At the end Mr. Obama makes an appeal towards the students by summing up his main ideas and mentioning the evolution younger generation could archieveachieve by going abroad.
In Conclusionconclusion to Mr. President Barack ObamasObama's speech, you can tell he was successful appealing to the younger generation.
